t: Jeremiah 9
Oh*p that my head were waters, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!
Oh*p that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they be all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
And*p they bend their tongues like their bow for lies: but they are not valiant for the truth upon the earth; for they proceed from evil to evil, and they know not me, saith the Lord.*s
Take*p ye heed every one of his neighbour, and trust ye not in any brother: for every brother will utterly supplant, and every neighbour will walk with slanders.
And*p they will deceive every one his neighbour, and will not speak the truth: they have taught their tongue to speak lies, and weary themselves to commit iniquity.
Thine*p habitation is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they refuse to know me, saith the Lord.*s
Therefore*p thus saith the Lord*s of hosts, Behold, I will melt them, and try them; for how shall I do for the daughter of my people?
Their*p tongue is as an arrow shot out; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh peaceably to his neighbour with his mouth, but in heart he layeth his wait.
Shall*p I not visit them for these things? saith the Lord:*s shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

For*p the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing, and for the habitations of the wilderness a lamentation, because they are burned up, so that none can pass through them; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and the beast are fled; they are gone.
And*p I will make Jerusalem heaps, and a den of dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without an inhabitant.

Who*p is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to whom the mouth of the Lord*s hath spoken, that he may declare it, for what the land perisheth and is burned up like a wilderness, that none passeth through?
And*p the Lord*s saith, Because they have forsaken my law which I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, neither walked therein;
But*p have walked after the imagination of their own heart, and after Baalim, which their fathers taught them:
Therefore*p thus saith the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will feed them, even this people, with wormwood, and give them water of gall to drink.
I*p will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor their fathers have known: and I will send a sword after them, till I have consumed them.
Thus*p saith the Lord*s of hosts, Consider ye, and call for the mourning women, that they may come; and send for cunning women, that they may come:
And*p let them make haste, and take up a wailing for us, that our eyes may run down with tears, and our eyelids gush out with waters.
For*p a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion, How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded, because we have forsaken the land, because our dwellings have cast us out.
Yet*p hear the word of the Lord,*s O ye women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth, and teach your daughters wailing, and every one her neighbour lamentation.
For*p death is come up into our windows, and is entered into our palaces, to cut off the children from without, and the young men from the streets.
Speak,*p Thus saith the Lord,*s Even the carcases of men shall fall as dung upon the open field, and as the handful after the harvestman, and none shall gather them.
Thus*p saith the Lord,*s Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:

But*p let him that glorieth glory in this, that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the Lord*s which exercise lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth: for in these things I delight, saith the Lord.*s
Behold,*p the days come, saith the Lord,*s that I will punish all them which are circumcised with the uncircumcised;

Egypt,*p and Judah, and Edom, and the children of Ammon, and Moab, and all that are in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: for all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart.
